SENT.plain: Cerebral insults of cardiac origin are often of great functional importance
The most common cause is atrial fibrillation
Other sources of cerebral embolies, even if rare, such as cardiac tumors, must not be ignored
Many of these patients present neurologic symptoms
The diagnosis is established on ecco-cardiography
Surgical management is the treatment of choice
We discuss a young patient with multiple cerebral insults and a papillary cardiac tumor
